meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: BAD BUSINESS MODELS

div.a: Streaming Services Rake In Money And Then Send It Off In Royalties

div.div: Spotify and Pandora exemplify the business challenges for digital-music companies. Both are losing money, and for largely the same reason: the cost of music royalties.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OlDMnE&via=Digg&text=Streaming Services Rake In Money And Then Send It Off In Royalties

div.div: HUNGER

div.a: Nearly 1/5 Of American Has Been Short Of Money For Food

div.div: Nearly one in five Americans has not had enough money to buy the food they needed in the past year, a Gallup poll finds.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SEYWQ2&via=Digg&text=Nearly 1/5 Of American Has Been Short Of Money For Food

div.div: OVER OUR DEAD BODIES

div.a: Food Shortages Could Force World Into Vegetarianism

div.div: Leading water scientists have issued one of the sternest warnings yet about global food supplies, saying that the world's population may have to switch almost completely to a vegetarian diet over the next 40 years to avoid catastrophic shortages.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OjlCzf&via=Digg&text=Food Shortages Could Force World Into Vegetarianism

div.div: POLITICS

div.a: Man With Machete Arrested At Republican National Convention

div.div: At least one arrest has been made during protests near the site of the Republican National Convention in Tampa.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RdYHWj&via=Digg&text=Man With Machete Arrested At Republican National Convention

div.div: DINOSAURS

div.a: NASA Discovers Dinosaur Footprints In Its Backyard

div.div: Let's face it: the words "NASA," "space" and "dinosaur" don't go together nearly as often as they should, which is why everyone is so excited over the footprint recently discovered at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

li.div: NASA discovers 100 million year old dinosaur footprints in its backyard [Dinosaurs] io9.com/5937916/nasa-discovers...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Nv6HBt&via=Digg&text=NASA Discovers Dinosaur Footprints In Its Backyard

div.div: CUE INTERNET OUTRAGE IN 3, 2, 1...

div.a: FCC Considers Tax On Internet Service

div.div: The Federal Communications Commission is eyeing a proposal to tax broadband internet service in order to funnel money to the Connect America fund, which was created last year to expand internet access.
THE FUTURE

div.a: Can An Algorithm Write A Better News Story Than A Human?

div.div: An industry insider has estimated that in 15 years, more than 90% of news stories will be written by a computer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/J7PQ4b&via=Digg&text=Can An Algorithm Write A Better News Story Than A Human?

div.div: GROUND DRONES?!

div.a: The Hardcore Security Gear Protecting The Conventions

div.div: Congress gave Tampa and Charlotte police $50 million each to keep America's egg-throwing anarchists at bay during the Republican and Democratic conventions. Turns out, both cities got quite a lot of bang for their buck.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Phb0Sj&via=Digg&text=The Hardcore Security Gear Protecting The Conventions

div.div: VIRAL GOLD

div.a: How One Talent Agency Helps The Meme-Famous Profit

div.div: YouTube has proved itself to be a viable launching pad for professional performers who produce popular videos. But other than joining YouTube's revenue-sharing partner program, there have been few ways for a random parent or pet owner to cash in on a hit.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NyEYBa&via=Digg&text=How One Talent Agency Helps The Meme-Famous Profit

div.div: ANTS

A collaboration between a Stanford ant biologist and a computer scientist has revealed that the behavior of harvester ants as they forage for food mirrors the protocols that control traffic on the Internet.

li.div: Ants do TCP. Now I just have to figure out how to spread NACKs around the house engineering.stanford.edu/news/... via @prismatic

div.div: YOU'VE GOTTA FIGHT FOR YOUR RIGHT TO PRINT

div.a: Why The Next Battle For Internet Freedom Will Be Over 3D Printing

div.div: Eventually, 3D printing will enable individuals to print just about anything from the comfort of their own homes. At which point the question will arise: how will this be regulated?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TcAXDw&via=Digg&text=Why The Next Battle For Internet Freedom Will Be Over 3D Printing

div.div: SOUNDS OFF LIKE HE'S GOT A PAIR

div.a: R. Lee Ermey Claims Geico Fired Him For Bashing Obama

div.div: Ever wonder why R. Lee Ermey only did one hysterical commericla for Geico? The "Full Metal Jacket" star says the insurance giant gave him a pink slip because of his political beliefs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pbp8vc&via=Digg&text=R. Lee Ermey Claims Geico Fired Him For Bashing Obama

div.div: PIRACY

div.a: How BitTorrent Aims To Change How Artists Get Paid

div.div: BitTorrent is actively working with artists to figure out how to help them make money with using BitTorrent distribution.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NpG86s&via=Digg&text=How BitTorrent Aims To Change How Artists Get Paid

div.div: JET PACKS

div.a: The World's First Jet Pack Wedding

div.div: Grant and Amanda Engler were married Thursday in Newport Beach. Their wedding, which was organized by ZOZI, an "adventure travel" start-up, is believed to be the world's first jet pack wedding.
SOME HEADLINES WRITE THEMSELVES
Over 350 prostitutes are currently occupying beds in Texan jails at the moment and some state officials are starting to wonder if that makes any sense at all.
